reference.title: Using an existing dictionary as model

section.p: All dictionaries have a dictionary entry structure. In you can use the given default structure, use an existing dictionary structure with or without changes, or define a new structure based on all the available entry fields.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: Decide on which dictionary entry fields your dictionary is to contain.

section.title: Calling sequence
section.p:
Select:
The Dictionary List window.
New… from the File menu. The New Dictionary window is displayed.
Yes… next to the Use existing dictionary as model option.
The Use Existing Dictionary as Model window is displayed (see ). windowsUse Existing Dictionary as Model Use Existing Dictionary as Model windowFigure shows Use Existing Dictionary as Model window

section.title: Options and parameters
section.p: The list of existing dictionaries is displayed in the list box. Select a dictionary with the structure you want to use as a model from this list or select -Master-, which contains all the entry fields predefined by .
Click Select to return to the New Dictionary window where you can view and change the selected entry structure by selecting the Change entry fields option.

section.title: Results
section.p: You have determined which entry structure to use as a base for the new dictionary.
